PAINTING YOU A PICTURE.Definition: describing something so you can imagine it clearly

HIDE AND SEEK.Definition: a children's game where one person hides and others look for them

OTHERWISE.Definition: in a different way; if not

UNEVENTFUL.Definition: not marked by interesting or exciting events

PERSUADE.Definition: make him do it by talking to him

CIRCLING.Definition: moving around in a round path

SUSPICIONS.Definition: feelings that something bad might have been true

CORDONED OFF.Definition: closed off by police so people couldn't enter

TURF WAR.Definition: a fight about who controls an area

FEUDING.Definition: fighting or arguing for a long time

TERRITORY.Definition: an area controlled by a group

GRENADES.Definition: small bombs that can be thrown

PLANTED.Definition: put secretly in a place to cause harm

PERPETRATORS.Definition: people who carry out the crimes

SUSPECTS.Definition: people the police thought may have done a crime

BUCKING THE TREND.Definition: going in the opposite direction from what normally happens

TREND.Definition: the way things usually go over time

TRIGGERS.Definition: parts of guns you pull to shoot

MAKEUP.Definition: who they are made of; their parts

HIERARCHICAL.Definition: arranged in levels, with some people above others

ECHELONS.Definition: levels or ranks in a group

STAKES.Definition: what they can lose or gain

RECRUITED.Definition: brought into a group; invited to join

DEVALUATION.Definition: the reduction of the worth or importance of it

MILIEU.Definition: environment; the kind of world they live in

DEED.Definition: an action, especially a serious one

TEMPTED.Definition: wanting to do it even if it is wrong

ABJECT POVERTY.Definition: extreme poverty; being very, very poor

LAST RESORT.Definition: the final choice when nothing else works

REHABILITATE.Definition: help them get better and live normally again

DISPOSABLE.Definition: can be thrown away; easily replaced

EXPLOITATION.Definition: using unfairly, taking advantage of the situation

MILITIA.Definition: a group of armed people who were not regular soldiers

FLOODED.Definition: filled with too much of them

CIRCULATING.Definition: moving around from place to place

INTERCEPT.Definition: stop them before they reach their target

PREVENTIVE.Definition: done to stop something before it happens

ADEQUATELY.Definition: well enough; in a good enough way

TRIGGER.Definition: the part of a gun you pull to shoot

SCAREMONGERING.Definition: spreading fear by telling scary stories
